title: Pages fail to load when a trailing slash is appended

labels.name: status:confirmed
labels.description: Bug has been confirmed by the Streamlit team

body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

When loading a page other than the homepage in a Streamlit application, appending a trailing "/" to the URL prevents the page from loading. Inspecting the console reveals that `main.7994a814.js` contains an HTML file rather than a JS file, and so the browser fails to parse it. The specific error is: `Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token '<' (at main.7994a814.js:1:1)`

### Reproducible Code Example

#### In ~/streamlit_project_root:
```zsh
python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate
pip install streamlit
touch Homepage.py
mkdir pages && cd pages && touch 01_TestPage.py && cd ..
```

#### Directory structure should look like this:
```zsh
streamlit_project_root
├── Homepage.py
└── pages
    └── 01_TestPage.py
```

#### Homepage.py:
```python
import streamlit as st

st.write("Hello world! This is the homepage")
```

#### 01_TestPage.py:
```python
import streamlit as st

st.write("Hello world! This is 01_TestPage.py")
```

#### In ~/streamlit_project_root:
```zsh
streamlit run Homepage.py
```

#### In a new terminal tab:
```zsh
open http://localhost:8501/TestPage/ # note the trailing slash
``` 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open a Streamlit multi-page app
2. Navigate to one of the sub-pages
3. Add a trailing "/" to the URL (if there wasn't one before)
4. Observe blank white screen and SyntaxError in the browser console

### Expected Behavior

Pages should load correctly regardless of the presence or absence of a trailing slash in the URL.

### Current Behavior

The page does not load (blank white screen) and the browser console reveals a syntax error in `main.7994a814.js`. The first character in that file is the "<" of `<!doctype html>`, and it is this character that throws the syntax error. This is understandable, as trying to parse HTML as a Javascript file is a recipe for failure.

![Screenshot 2024-07-22 at 12 13 24](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1f8cefdd-1a7b-425a-a422-25484b56bdab)

![Screenshot 2024-07-22 at 12 16 09](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6bf66257-116a-4843-b085-1eb71937290c)


### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.36.0
- Python version: 3.12.3
- Operating System (the issue occurs both locally and in our containerized on-prem instance):
    - Prod container: [ubi8/python-312](https://catalog.redhat.com/software/containers/ubi8/python-312/657c12cade3664622a12ed50?container-tabs=overview)
    - Local development OS: macOS Sonoma 14.5
- Browser: Google Chrome 126.0.6478.183


### Additional Information

_No response_
